subject: Basketball
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Connecticut Coach Jim Calhoun said he planned to return for a 24th season at the university. Calhoun’s Huskies finished the season at 31-5, losing in the national semifinals to Michigan State. Several off-the-court issues had prompted questions about Calhoun’s future, including an investigation into UConn’s recruitment of the former player Nate Miles. Calhoun has acknowledged that he or his staff may have made mistakes in recruiting Miles. Calhoun also has been treated for cancer three times during his UConn career, including last summer when he successfully battled skin cancer.
